intro: Chilenia fobeana, commonly known as the Chilean thornapple, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Chile. It is a member of the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant features showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. Its leaves are alternate and have a rough, hairy texture. Chilenia fobeana is often found in dry, rocky habitats and can thrive in arid conditions.
